title: What are good sources to learn analog electronics? - Quora

response.answer_text: To learn analog electronics I would recommend following sources and books: Lectures: Rajavi lecture series:http://Razavi Electronics: http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL7qUW0KPfsIIOPOKL84wK_Qj9N7gvJX6v NPTEL:http://ANALOG CIRCUITS BY Dr.SHANTHI PAVAN SIR: http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL16BAECF919A0D79C I would recommend you to go for rajavi lectures because they are to the point and concise , and if you are studying for gate they are very useful to learn each and every concept. Books: Fundamentals of Microelectronics-Behzad Razavi( This book is based on lectures so you will also have the content and numericals also) Fundamentals of Microelectronics - Google Search Microelectronic circuit (analysis and design)-M. Rashid http://Check this out: Microelectronic Circuits: Analysis and Design CL Engineering https://www.amazon.com/dp/0495667722/ref=cm_sw_r_wa_awdb_lTPYzb2PN3EGY

Hi… By learning How Resistor Capacitor and Inductor Works.By learning How Analog industry changed from Vacuum Tube to ULSIBy learning the power of Amplifier, Use of it.By learning how discrete components behave depending on Voltage, Ampere and Wattage.By learning the Impedance.By playing with electrons between “Transistor’s Saturation point” to “Cut-off/Breakdown mode”.By converting a Transistor to variable resistor to a switch.By learning Why Mosfet for switching rather than transistor and why Transistor used as amplifier rather than Mosfet.By learning why Analog is different than Digital?By loving Analog more than Digital, by showing love to her with time spent regularly, by gaining knowledge and experience when few capacitors busted and few components burned for lack of knowledge…Regards, SaV
